titleStmt.title: Cursus osteologicus being a compleat doctrine of the bones according to the newest and most refin'd notions of anatomy : shewing their nature, substance, composition, manner of ossification, nourishment, &c. ... : to which is annex'd by way of appendix, an excellent method of whitening, cleansing, preparing, and uniting the bones, to form a movable skeleton ... / by Robert Baker, Chirurgeon.
titleStmt.author: Baker, Robert, Chirurgeon.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. Dawks, for D. Browne ... and R. Clavell ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in British Library.
